head.title: Treasury to Auction Only Bills This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury to Auction Only Bills This Week

block.p: The Treasury this week plans to hold only its regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills, which is scheduled for today.
Late in the day on Friday, three-month bills traded at 4.02 percent and six-month bills at 4.12 percent.
The Treasury this week plans to hold only its regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills, which is scheduled for today.
Late in the day on Friday, three-month bills traded at 4.02 percent and six-month bills at 4.12 percent.
The Federally chartered Student Loan Marketing Association, known as Sallie Mae, will price $600 million of floating-rate notes today.
The following fixed-income issues are scheduled for this week: TAXABLE ONE DAY THIS WEEK
AES Corp. $40 million convertible subordinated debentures, due 2002. Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette.
Comptronix Corp., $30 million convertible subordinated debentures, due 2002. Morgan Keegan.

Consolidated Freightways Inc., six million depository shares, each representing one-tenth share of convertible preferred yield-enhanced stock, providing about $100 million in proceeds. Goldman, Sachs.
Continental Homes Holding Corp., $30 million convertible subordinated notes, due 2002. Kidder, Peabody.
Santander Overseas Bank, nine million shares noncumulative $25 preferred stock. Merrill Lynch.
Seitel Inc., $12.5 million convertible subordinated debentures 2002. American Securities Corp.
Seligman Quality Municipal Fund Inc., 690 shares of municipal auction-rate cumulative stocks at $50 a share. Lehman Brothers.
Toll Corp., $75 million senior subordinated notes, due 2002, Merrill Lynch.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY THIS WEEK
Connecticut, $465 million general obligation bonds. Merrill Lynch.
Clackamas County, Ore., Hospital Facility, $89.8 million series A and B refunding bonds. First Boston.
Illinois Health Facilities Authority, $50 million revenue bonds for South Suburban Hospital. Ziegler Securities.
Idaho Student Loan Fund Marketing Association, $66.6 million student loan revenue refunding bonds. A. G. Edwards Sons.
Lower Colorado River Authority, $183 million junior lien refunding revenue bonds. Morgan Stanley.
Milwaukee Metropolitan Sewage District, $158 million bonds. Merrill Lynch.
New Jersey Housing and Mortgage Finance Agency, $148.5 million housing revenue bonds. Bear, Stearns.
New York State Health Facilities Authority, $50 million series A and B guaranteed service contract bonds (series B are taxable). Bear, Stearns.
New York State Thruway Authority, $85.6 million emergency highway construction and reconstruction bonds. Smith Barney, Harris Upham.
New York State Thruway Authority, $69.7 million emergency highway reconditioning and preservation bonds. Smith Barney, Harris Upham.
Phoenix, $258 million general obligation bonds. Goldman, Sachs.
Texas Municipal Power Agency, $450 million revenue refunding bonds. Goldman, Sachs.
Wichita, Kan., $50 million sales tax revenue bonds. Kidder, Peabody.
